content:
I failed to renew my ESET because their product no longer met my requirement of doing more good than harm. This is another example of using fear tactics to try and make yourself appear relevant and useful.

When you get an attachment in an email, it is not a file. It is a collection of MIME encoded text as emails can only contain text. So you have this text document sitting on your hard drive. The digital equivalent of a hard cover book.

Along comes ESET, takes the text, decodes it into it's original binary, converts it into the named attachment file, scans it and says "this is bad you have an infection sitting there waiting". Just as the bubonic plague is sitting waiting to escape from a medical text book. If does not even exist in the email until it is decoded. When will this be? When you try and open it or save the file to disk. What will happen then. Eset will block it as it clearly has to correct signature to do so.

Result so far, you are looking for something you have been told is bad that really is not going to hurt you or your computer if it exists in it's current form for a millennia on your hard disk.

Now the mail store file has no file names, because it is a single file. Pick any of your emails in Thunderbird and view the source. That is what Thunderbird stores. Immediately after the last email in the file. There are no file123 names, or any file names at all. Just an mbox file called inbox with a load of text in it.

I know nothing of mailstorehome and have no desire to learn about it. Thunderbird covers all of my mail needs without third party product to mess with storage, backups or anything else.

I suggest you right click on the account in the folder pane, select compact from the menu and let that run. Most of these type of alerts are for mail that has already been deleted. Often years ago and is no longer shown in the user interface because it is marked as deleted.

Only a compact removes the stored content from the file. Deleting it only marks it as deleted and hides the email.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Thank you for your resposne. I'll try to test it ASAP. Unfortunately it will take some time, as I don't have access to the machine for now.
creator: Zdenon

content:
One method would be to create a folder on desktop to receive eml emails - call it eg: Scan Emails Then use the 'ImportExportTools NG' addon - so install this addon extension. Right click on Inbox > ImportExportTools NG > Export all messages in folder > EML message format Choose the folder you created to receive them

Then run scan on that 'Scan Emails' folder and if it finds a problem then you can easily tell which email is bad.

Then delete the 'Scan Emails' folder and locate the bad email in 'Inbox' Delete bad email and then compact the Inbox.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
I hope you realize that IMAP is an incoming protocol and so is POP. So changing one to the other will have exactly Zero impact on issues with sending mail. Sounds like the typical poor support experience offered by Optus.

I am guessing that you are now on IMAP and the message bodies have to be downloaded as you select them and your antivirus is not fast enough doing what it does for the messages to arrive before you are supposed to see them.

content: notificationserver.dll wordt gebruikt door Thunderbird om meldingen, zoals nieuwe berichten, te kunnen tonen in Windows. Zie ook https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D153138. Als u de melding niet meer wilt zien in CCleaner, dan kunt u deze uitsluiten in CCleaner.
creator: Mozilla-assistent

content: Ik neem graag aan dat notificationserver.dll een nuttig stukje software is. Maar waar het om gaat is dat CCleaner hierin een ActiveX/COM-probleem detecteert. Dus mijn vraag waarom ActiveX/COM wordt gebruikt in Thunderbird's notificationserver.dll is nog niet beantwoord.
creator: leo.steijn

content: Dit is het antwoord dat ik terug krijg van de ontwikkelaars: "COM is used to interact with Windows Toast Notification API. https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/toolkit/mozapps/notificationserver/NotificationComServer.cpp". "The whole mechanism is based on a COM server started by Windows to respond to push notifications."

content: Alla fine ho risolto, seppure non mi sia chiaro come. Tutti i suggerimenti dalle varie discussioni in internet sono stati inutili, così come quello di next. Il PC in questione ha un solo utente, con diritti amministrativi, per cui non si poteva fare diversamente dall'eseguire Thunderbird in quel modo. Quello che ho fatto, alla disperata, è stato di creare per i messaggi di quell'account una cartella diversa da quella predefinita. Poi, nel timore di perdere così facendo i messaggi archiviati in altre sottocartelle di quella predefinita (es. Posta IN 2023), ho ricollegato l'account alla sua cartella predefinita. Tutto ha ripreso a funzionare. Non so se quello che ho fatto abbia avuto un effetto o se, semplicemente, il problema che era apparso senza motivo (visto che in quei giorni non avevo fatto niente che riguardasse Thunderbird, nemmeno aggiornamenti) se n'è andato altrettanto senza motivo comprensibile. Sono propenso a pensare che sia stato così, più che quel giochino di cartelle che ho fatto; ma chi lo sa! Grazie comunque.
creator: dario13

content: Ah, un'altra possibilità è che sia stato risolutivo il fatto di aver eliminato dalla casella di posta Aruba (accedendovi con webmail) tutti i messaggi archiviati e ancora presenti (15 giorni, dal 28 giugno al 13 luglio) e che quella installazione di Thunderbird cercava di scaricare di nuovo ad ogni accesso, bloccandosi nel farlo. Strano però che un altro Thunderbird da un altro PC non facesse tutti questi tentativi insensati di riscaricare email già scaricate. Però, forse era proprio per questo che l'altro Thunderbird non andava in palla, visto che non cercava di fare una cosa senza senso. Va beh, se dovesse ricapitare, per prima cosa eliminerò dalla webmail i messaggi già scaricati, per vedere se questo resetta l'installazione impazzita di Thunderbird.

content: That is unusual. The addressbook file name is abook.sqlite. Possibly it is corrupted? The 128 upgrade is not being announced yet, as there are possibly small bugs that will be trapped in initial days. You would have had to do this manually unless you use a separate app to handle software updates. you can verify presence of the file by clicking help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' and then see if the abook.sqlite file is present. If it is not being recognized, my thought would be to exit thunderbird, copy the abook.sqlite somewhere else, and the start TB, click the tools>import >import from a file, and select the file to attempt a recovery..

Nee, helaas. Deze werkt niet met Thunderbird 128.0esr. Wat met deze add-on kan is 2 kolommen toevoegen met het e-mailadres van de verzender of ontvanger.

Doe veel zaken via Marktplaats en zie nu afzender als b.v. : J. Kamps <j7t794k32rvn-3bb5ebdd9c85794523a4ce2b739d2d503a35cd3-mp-mp@mail.marktplaats.nl>.

Je ziet dus nu naam en e-mailadres in de kolom "Van" of "Correspondenten". Als je 10 van zulke e-mails hebt, moet je dus goed kijken, hoeveel er zijn van dezelfde persoon afkomstig zijn. Mooiste zou zijn een kolom voor de naam en een kolom voor het e-mailadres, zodat je zelf zou kunnen bepalen, of je het e-mailadres wil zien.

Mvg,

Johan Kamps

content: My suggestion was to reduce the inbox only. Deleting inbox and inbox.msf while TB is not running and then restarting will do that - after you change the setting for 400 days. The msf file is the index, not the messages. You lose none of your profile settings.

content:
Is SMTP enabled in the tenant? One of the things Microsoft are doing is disabling the SMTP server in the exchange instance used by the domain and the domain admin has to re enable it.

The alternative is to use the OWL add-on as it uses the exchange web service to do it's magic.

content: This is one of my frustrations with thunderbird, although I love it of course. The problem is that the menu bar has 'tools' that link to 'settings' and then to set default, but the hamburger menu's tool menu does not, as settings is already on that menu. And chatgpt is referencing a prior version (pre 102) version of thunderbird when 'options' was a menu entry. If using menu bar, look for tools>Settings>general. if using hamburger menu, click settings>general
creator: davidsk

content: - first, you need to be in table view. If not, click the icon to the right of the 'quick filter' button, - in table view, - highlight a single folder and set the columns to your preferences - then click the icon at right of menu bar in message view and click the 'apply columns to' and from there select 'folder and its children' and that can be expanded to set for the entire account. - there is another option on that same icon to apply view. (I have a crude video that demonstrates this at https://davidkirk.org/SettingDefaultFolderView.mp4 )
creator: davidsk

content:
When you are using IMAP and can not connect to the server you see nothing. That is essentially by design.

However, I would expect the account name to show in the account pane and I think that is the blank space in your screen shot.

What version of Thunderbird are you using?

In the troubleshooting information on the help menu are details of your accounts. Can you please copy those (Drag your mouse over the information and press Ctrl+C) then past the result into a reply on the forum.

You might have an account issue, but if you do there probably is more to this.

Is there any other sign into live web pages open in the background? That is the authentication process for oauth and may explain a lack of information in the Thunderbird user interface..

Zmíněnou událost můžete také prověřit na stránce“ = Preverte či mate vypnuté dvojstupňové overenie: https://myaccount.google.com/security?pli=1#signin a zapnite aj prístup pre menej bezpečné aplikácie: https://www.google.com/settings/security/lesssecureapps = A ešte preverte na webe, či ste si vo svojom účte povolili POP, alebo IMAP prístup: http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/01/12/Gmail_POP3_povoleny.jpg http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/01/12/gmail_IMPAP.jpg

content:
If you try to login to webmail account but cannot remember password then you click on the 'Forgotten password' link and follow instructions. The one thing it does not do is send an email to the account to which you are trying to get access.

re :I can't get into my email because I get an error message saying the password is wrong.

What is the exact error message word for word and what server are you using?

If you already had the account up and running ok, then it's likely you had the password stored in Thunderbird. Have you checked to see if your password was saved in Thunderbird? Settings > Privacy & Security Click on 'Saved Passwords' click on 'Show Passwords'

There may be nothing wrong with the password, but not for the server settings you are using. So, you need to post the following: In Thunderbird Help > Troubleshooting Information Scroll to 'Mail and News Accounts' Copy all text in that area and post it into this forum question.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
When you reset the primary password, it erases all account passwords for security purposes. 

Choose Tools -> Developer Tools > Error Console, paste the expression:    openDialog("chrome://pippki/content/resetpassword.xhtml")     and press the Evaluate button. That will open a dialog asking you if you want to reset your password. If Evaluate is not seen, press enter key. When prompted, press the Reset button.

content:
Most probably stop your antivirus from scanning mail and crashing in the process in the background, or actively refusing internet access because oyu have a new version. But based on the information you have supplied all I can do is guess.

For us to better investigate this issue, we will need some more information.

Could you please do the following?

  1. Open the menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information, then click Copy text to Clipboard.
  2. Go to https://pastebin.mozilla.org/, paste the clipboard by right clicking in the large text area, select paste from the menu, change the retention period to expire in 28 days, use the Paste Snippet button to create a page containing your info, then copy the resulting URL (address) of the page created.
  3. Open a reply to this post, and paste the URL to your troubleshooting information you just copied.
  4. Please also provide results for the following test on your system
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected in Thunderbird troubleshooting mode?
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected with your OS started in safe mode with Networking. Instructions for each operating system: Windows 10/11, Windows 8, Windows 7, OSX

content:
Please supply information because we cannot guess.

What OS are you using ? Where did you get Thunderbird? flatpak? Official website : https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/  ? Or somewhere else, but tell us where you got it from.

The information we need is in Thunderbird and it's located : Help > Troubleshooting Information If for some reason you do not see a 'Copy text to clipboard' button in top left area then Copy sections as specific below and paste the data into this forum question.

Under 'Application Basics' section Copy and paste the following data:

  • Version, Build ID, update channel,

Under 'Mail and News Accounts' We need to know exactly what Thunderbird says it's using for account settings. Obviously not the password. Copy all the data and post it into this question.

Under 'Addons' Copy all data and post info into this question.

Under 'Security Software' Copy all data and post info into this question.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Do you use a VPN? Some Linux based systems have discovered a VPN being enabled. Some people using Anti-Virus products have discovered a VPN being auto enabled.

Disable/switch off any VPN because many servers think someone is trying to hack your account so they block access to server.

Do you use a product such as Apache Xamph? Many people may use such software if they manage a website. This product uses localhost, so you may need to switch it off whilst setting up some accounts especially those that use Oauth eg: accounts hosted on gmail, yahoo or outlook servers.
creator: Toad-Hall
